title: Move Limits to JSON Init File
objective: Learn how to define configuration parameters in an app's JSON init file.

exercise.instructions:
1. Add a comma at the end of the HI_OBJECT_STATUS_TLM_TOPICID line
2. Add EXOBJ_COUNTER_LO_LIM: 10,
3. Add EXOBJ_COUNTER_HI_LIM: 50

Note the parameter variable names must be in double quotes.

1. Locate the '#define CFG_HELLO_OBJ_STATUS_TLM_TOPICID' and after that line add:
    '#define CFG_EXOBJ_COUNTER_LO_LIM   EXOBJ_COUNTER_LO_LIM'
    '#define CFG_EXOBJ_COUNTER_HI_LIM   EXOBJ_COUNTER_HI_LIM'
2. Locate the 'XX(HI_OBJECT_STATUS_TLM_TOPICID,uint32) \' and after that line add:
    'XX(EXOBJ_COUNTER_LO_LIM,uint32) \'
    'XX(EXOBJ_COUNTER_HI_LIM,uint32)'

Note the #define and XX() definitions don't have to be in the same order but it helps readability.
1. Locate the 'Counter Limits' comment block and comment out the EXOBJ_COUNTER_HI_LIM and EXOBJ_COUNTER_LO_LIM macros definitions

1. Locate the EXOBJ_Constructor() function and after the 'ExObj->CounterMode = HI_OBJECT_CounterMode_Increment;' line add:
    A. 'ExObj->CounterLoLim = INITBL_GetIntConfig(IniTbl, CFG_EXOBJ_COUNTER_LO_LIM);'
    B. 'ExObj->CounterHiLim = INITBL_GetIntConfig(IniTbl, CFG_EXOBJ_COUNTER_HI_LIM);'
    C. Change ExObj->CounterValue = from EXOBJ_COUNTER_LO_LIM to ExObj->CounterLoLim;

1. Locate the EXOBJ_Execute() function:
    A. Replace all 'EXOBJ_COUNTER_LO_LIM' occurrences with ExObj->CounterLoLim
    B. Replace all 'EXOBJ_COUNTER_HI_LIM' occurrences with ExObj->CounterHiLim
